page.title: 07OCCUPATIONS IN EGERTON
page.content: Egerton was primarily a rural community until the 1800's, when it became a cotton centre with several mills. The mills have closed, their buildings are used for diverse small industries, which provide a few local jobs. The farms are mostly family concerns, with few employees. The majority of residents, 80%, work outside the area, with 42% working in Bolton, 38% further afield. The majority are employed in professional, managerial or non-manual occupations. Unemployment is considerably below the area and national levels. In 60% of families both husband and wife work. 17% of the adult population are retired. 14% of adults have worked at some time in the local textile industry.
